intro: Heisteria barbata, commonly known as the hairy heister, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Simaroubaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has elliptical leaves with a rough texture. Heisteria barbata produces yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered in small inflorescences. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
